titleStmt.title: A. J. Bartlett et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6143

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To his Excellency Thomas E Bramlett
Govenor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky=We the undersigned Citizens of Trimble County Kentucky would most respectfully represents to your Excellency that at the May Term of the Trimble Circuit Court for the year 1864 Our worthy fellow citizen James Voiers was fined the sum of twenty dollars for gameing -- I. E. Pitching Quoits or Dollars, now we represent that the sd James Voiers is a clever industrious and poor young man -- and is not and has never been in the habit of Gameing in any way -- that we believe he at the time he committed the offence was wholy unaware that he was committing any violation of Law, we would therefore request your Excellency to remit sd fine and as in duty bound we will ever pray.

A J Bartlett
Wm F Peak
F. Willis
J. P. Strother
F. A. Adams
Jacob Ferguson
J. H. Lane
George Spilman
D S Lane
F. E. Skidmore
E M Garriott

Trimble Cir Ct
vs
Jas Voiers
$20
P
